title.rendered: Sir Viv Richards and Javed Miandad De-Stress in a Fun Bike Race in Pakistan Junior League

content.rendered:
It was a fun-making cycle race between two Cricket Stalwarts Javed Miandad and Sir Vivian Richards in the Pakistan Junior League started on October 6 in Pakistan to explore more young talent helpful to Pakistan’s main side in the future.

The video has been shared exclusively by the Pakistan Cricket handle on Sunday.

Sir Viv Richards has joined the pool of Mentors for the Pakistan Junior League teams followed by Javed Miandad, Shoaib Malik, Tahir Imran, Shahid Afridi, Coli Munro, and Daren Sammy. Sir Richards has contributed earlier for Sixth Edition out of Seven for PSL from the Quetta Gladiator’s Campaign to guide them for the title win in 2019.

As an all-rounder from the West Indies Cricket team, Sir Vivian Richards has a remarkable record with a glorious history of two-time active participant of the winning team of the West Indies in the World Cup. With an average of 50 in his Tests career, he made 8,540 runs in 121 matches with some unbeaten knocks. Richards played 187 ODIs and made 6,721 runs as a bowler taking 32 Test wickets and 118 ODI wickets.

Where the Pakistan legendary cricketer Javed Miandad crafted 8832 runs inclusive of 23 centuries in 124 Tests and scored 7381 runs in 233 ODIs with eight centuries.

Miandad quoted, I am so thrilled to work with sir Vivian Richards, who has remained as one of the greatest players of the game. Pakistan Junior League will provide a helpful platform to the young cricketing talent of the country in the longer run, due to its innovative exciting concept for the junior players.

Javed Miandad

Sir Vivian Richards shared his views I am very much excited to get united once again with earlier Cricket, as I can recollect some great memories with Javed. He was a great fighter and tough competitor during our times. I am working with him now for Pakistan Junior League with an innovative and exciting concept.

Sir Vivian Richards

Read also:Women’s Asia Cup Final: Indian wins Asia Cup final, beats Sri Lanka by 8 wickets
